Clip.Title: ANIMALS ALOFT
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Look into the archives of the National Air and Space Museum where incredible stories of thrilling adventures will be revealed, all with animals riding shotgun.

Clip.Title: MISSION PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Paradise is a myth, a dream, a utopia, a religious concept. But for many people, it is above all a quest. In the four corners of the planet, Mako, Amina Alaoui, Adolf Höll, Ibis and Jean Delumeau have got a little closer to paradise than anyone else. This is their story, both a travelogue and their personal diaries.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join the Bionic Vet and his staff as they tend to a puppy in shock, a police dog in agony and a cat about to take her first (reluctant) dip into the center's hydrotherapy pool.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: One thousand miles off the southeast coast of Argentina sits the sub-Antarctic island of South Georgia in the Southern Ocean. About the size of Rhode Island, it's a breathtaking sight - long and narrow - shaped like a huge fractured whalebone. Massive glaciers, ice caps and snowfields cover about 75% of the island, but the land is far from desolate

Clip.EpisodeSummary: Look into the archives of the National Air and Space Museum where incredible stories of thrilling adventures will be revealed, all with animals riding shotgun.

Clip.Title: MISSION PARADISE

This is their story, both a travelogue and their personal diaries.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: With its' lower than sea-level countryside, the Netherlands has a big problem on its hands if sea levels keep rising.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the Gulf of St. Lawrence, one of the East Coast's hidden wonders lies below - the Magdalene Islands - offering some of the region's top beaches, grassy hillsides and spectacular cliff faces.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Eastern Coastline of Nova Scotia is a living historical record of the centuries-old battle between the French and the English in the New World, along one of the Atlantic's most remote, hostile coastlines.

Clip.EpisodeSummary: Look into the archives of the National Air and Space Museum where incredible stories of thrilling adventures will be revealed, all with animals riding shotgun.

Clip.Title: MISSION PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Paradise is a myth, a dream, a utopia, a religious concept. But for many people, it is above all a quest. In the four corners of the planet, Mako, Amina Alaoui, Adolf Höll, Ibis and Jean Delumeau have got a little closer to paradise than anyone else. This is their story, both a travelogue and their personal diaries.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From its Great Lakes to its Grand Canyon, its Rocky Mountain peaks to its Key West reefs, America is a land of amazing destinations. This aerial adventure over the nation's most remarkable landscapes and landmarks captures the breathtaking beauty of America, while demonstrating how its sense of wonder has inspired countless artists, thinkers, and revolutionaries.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From its Great Lakes to its Grand Canyon, its Rocky Mountain peaks to its Key West reefs, America is a land of amazing destinations. This aerial adventure over the nation's most remarkable landscapes and landmarks captures the breathtaking beauty of America, while demonstrating how its sense of wonder has inspired countless artists, thinkers, and revolutionaries.

Clip.Title: A SHOT TO SAVE THE WORLD
Clip.Episode: A Shot To Save The World
Clip.EpisodeSummary: It was 1952, and polio had reached outbreak levels in America. There was no known cause, no cure, and no help in sight for parents desperate to protect their children. Our nation's hope was placed in a 33-year-old scientist, working from a basement lab in Pittsburgh. His name was Jonas Salk, and in just a few years, he would bring infantile paralysis to its knees and change the course of medical history. Travel back to a world gripped in fear and see how Dr. Salk, with his dedicated staff, a young charity, and a faithful nation, came together to conquer polio.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Canada's easternmost point to Europe's westernmost point, this aerial survey explores the Atlantic coastline, from the wonders of St. John's Newfoundland and the Avalon peninsula - to the unique islands of St. Pierre and Miquelon.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From St. John's heading north, the Newfoundland coastline is a maze of iconic bays and inlets - from world-famous Fogo Island, to the abandoned fishing settlements along the island's Northern peninsula.

Clip.Title: TANK ON THE MOON
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Revealing near-lost stories about Soviet-made robots that patrolled the Lunar surface in the 1970s.

Clip.Title: BOTS OR BODIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Is man or machine better equipped to handle the rigors and risks of space exploration? Now that Mars is in our sights, would we be pushing our luck or pushing the boundaries?

Clip.Title: DOOMSDAY IN TUNGUSKA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join the ongoing investigation over what caused one of the biggest explosions in history in June 1908, Siberia.

Clip.Title: DENYING THE MOON LANDING
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Apollo astronauts and scientific experts reflect on NASA's glorious achievement, and the shock of having their accomplishments questioned 40 years later.

Clip.Title: TANK ON THE MOON
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Revealing near-lost stories about Soviet-made robots that patrolled the Lunar surface in the 1970s.
